scene.title: ZOOTOPIA
scene.text: Written by Jared Bush & Phil Johnston Story by Byron Howard, Rich Moore, Jared Bush, Jim Reardon, Josie Trinidad, Phil Johnston and Jennifer Lee

scene.title: IN BLACK --
scene.text: We hear the feral, primeval sounds of a jungle at night. A timpani bangs an ominous beat.

scene.title: A JUNGLE - NIGHT
scene.text: A BUNNY nervously walks through the dark, foreboding forest, frightened by every shadow and moving leaf.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Fear. Treachery. Bloodlust! Thousands of years ago, these were the forces that ruled our world. A world where prey were scared of predators. And predators had an uncontrollable biological urge to maim and maul and...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The timpani crescendos. A JAGUAR leaps out of the shadows, attacks the bunny, who screams--

scene.title: INSIDE A BARN - A JUNGLE
scene.text: The action continues-- as imagined by an amateur stage production.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Blood, blood, blood!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Reams of red papier mأ¢chأ© entrails ooze from the bunny. And when those run out-- projectile ketchup. Reveal: These are ANIMAL KID ACTORS. The bunny, JUDY HOPPS, 10, is our hero. And this is her play being staged. A banner reads: CARROT DAYS TALENT SHOW!

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: And death.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The CROWD looks on, confused. The music goes discordant as BOBBY CATMULL, a bobcat, bangs a drum.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Back then, the world was divided in two. Vicious predator or Meek prey.

TWO BOXES drop down, labeled VICIOUS PREDATOR and MEEK PREY. The PREDATOR box lands on the jaguar. The MEEK PREY box lands on Judy. Her entrails get stuck outside the box. She drags them underneath with her.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: But over time, we evolved, and moved beyond our primitive savage ways.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: A YOUNG SHEEP wearing a white muumuu and a cardboard rainbow on his head does an improvisational dance across the stage. Judy and the jaguar burst out of their boxes, now wearing white muumuus, too.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Now, predator and prey live in harmony.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy and the jaguar shake hands as the sheep throws glitter.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: And every young mammal has multitudinous opportunities.

scene.title: ASTRONAUT SHEEP
scene.text: Yeah, I don't have to cower in a herd anymore.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Jaguar rips off his muumuu. She's wearing a homemade astronaut costume.

scene.title: ASTRONAUT SHEEP
scene.text: Instead I can be an astronaut.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Catmull plays a slide whistle.

scene.title: ACTUARY JAGUAR
scene.text: I don't have to be a lonely hunter any more.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Jaguar rips off his muumuu. He's dressed in a suit.

scene.title: ACTUARY
scene.text: Today I can hunt for tax exemptions. I'm gonna be an actuary!

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: And I can make the world a better place! I am going to be...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Catmull plays a 70s-style cop show theme on the boom box. Judy rips off her muumuu, revealing a POLICE OFFICER UNIFORM.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: A police officer!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy's parents, BONNIE & STU, look stunned. A mean fox kid, GIDEON GREY, snickers. He's sitting next to a WEASEL KID.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Bunny cop. That is the most stupidest thing I ever heard.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: It may seem impossible to small minds-- (points at Gideon) I'm looking at you Gideon Grey.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Catmull drops down a backdrop showing a bright city skyline. He hits play on an uplifting song.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: But just 211 miles away stands the great city of Zootopia! Where our ancestors first joined together in peace, and declared that anyone can be anything! Thank you and good night!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy gives a mighty thespian bow, to the sound of Catmull on organ. The audience applauds. Judy's parents look concerned.

scene.title: EXT. CARROT DAYS FESTIVAL - LATER THAT DAY
scene.text: A festival replete with food booths, games and rides-- all aggressively carrot-themed. Judy, in her Cop Costume, bounces along with her folks. We catch their conversation mid-stream.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Judy, you ever wonder how your mom and me got to be so darn happy?

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Nope.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Well, we gave up on our dreams and we settled, right Bon?

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Oh yes, that's right, Stu. We settled hard.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: See, that's the beauty of complacency, Jude. If you don't try anything new, you'll never fail.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: I like trying, actually.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: What your father means, hon, is it's gonna be difficult-- impossible even-- for you to become a police officer.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Right. There's never been a bunny cop.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: No.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Bunnies don't do that.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Never.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Never.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Oh. Then I guess I'll have to be the first one. Because I am gonna make the world... (parkours against a vendor's stand) A better place!

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: OR... um, heck, you wanna talk about making the world a better place--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The trio arrives at the Hopps Family Farm carrot booth, which is manned by too many children to count.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: --no better way to do it than becoming a carrot farmer.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Yes! Your dad, me, your 275 brothers and sisters-- we're changing the world.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Yep.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: One carrot at a time...

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Amen to that. Carrot farming is a noble profession.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy spots GIDEON GREY stalking some SMALL ANIMALS. She remains fixed on Gideon as Stu and Bonnie yap on obliviously.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Mmm hmm. Just putting the seeds in the ground.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Ahh, at one with the soil.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: We're back on Bonnie and Stu's conversation now.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: You get it. I mean, it's great to have dreams.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah, just as long as you don't believe in em too much. (finally noticing Judy's absence) Where in the heck'd she go?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: ACROSS THE FAIR... From behind a tree, Judy watches as Gideon Grey intimidates the astronaut sheep, SHARLA.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Gimme your tickets right now, or I'm gonna kick your meek little sheep butt.

scene.title: SHARLA
scene.text: Ow! Cut it out, Gideon!

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Baa-baa. What're ya gonna do, cry?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Gideon swipes Sharla's fair tickets.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Hey!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy charges toward the danger.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: You heard her. Cut it out.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Gideon turns. There's Judy, projecting the image of a tiny Clint Eastwood.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Nice costume, loser. What crazy world are you living in where you think a bunny could be a cop?

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Kindly return my friends' tickets.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Gideon pats the tickets in his pocket.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Come and get `em.... But watch out, `cause I'm a fox-- and like you said in your dumb little stage play, us predators used to eat prey. And that killer instinct's still in our Dunnahh.

scene.title: TRAVIS THE WOLF HENCHMAN KID
scene.text: (sotto, to Gideon) Uh, I'm pretty much sure it's pronounced D-N-A.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Don't tell me what I know, Travis.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: You don't scare me, Gideon.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Gideon shoves Judy. Hard. She falls. The other prey animals flee to safety behind a nearby tree, leaving her to face the thugs alone.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: You scared now?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy starts to tear up. Her nose starts to twitch.

scene.title: TRAVIS THE WOLF HENCHMAN KID
scene.text: Lookit her nose twitch. She is scared!

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Cry little baby bunny. Cry, cry --

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Suddenly-- BAM! Judy kicks Gideon in the face with her hind legs. He stumbles back, then checks his lip for blood.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Oh, you don't know when to quit, do ya?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He unsheathes his claws like a switchblade, then slaps her, drawing blood from her cheek. She cowers, as do her scared friends behind the tree.

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: I want you to remember this moment-- the next time you think you will ever be anything more than just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Gideon and his pal head off, laughing and high-fiving. The prey animals run back over to Judy, who wipes the blood from her cheek. She fights tears, defeated.

scene.title: GARETH THE DOUBTING SHEEP BOY
scene.text: That looks bad.

scene.title: SHARLA
scene.text: Are you okay, Judy?

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Yeah... Yeah, I'm okay.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy smiles and then whips out the tickets as she gets up.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Here you go.

scene.title: SHARLA
scene.text: Wow! You got our tickets!

scene.title: GARETH THE DOUBTING SHEEP BOY
scene.text: You're awesome, Judy!

scene.title: SHARLA
scene.text: Yeah! That Gideon Grey doesn't know what he's talkin' `bout.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: Well, he was right about one thing...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy picks up the cop hat, puts it on her head.

scene.title: YOUNG JUDY
scene.text: I don't know when to quit.

scene.title: EXT. POLICE ACADEMY TRAINING FACILITY - DAY
scene.text: Hopps and the comparatively huge CADETS sit in a circle as MAJOR FRIEDKIN, an intimidating drill instructor, lectures.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Listen up Cadets! Zootopia has 12 unique ecosystems within its city limits-- Tundra Town, Sahara Square, Rainforest District, to name a few. You're gonna have to master all of them before you hit the streets-- or guess what? (to Hopps) You'll be dead!

scene.title: IN SAHARA SQUARE SIMULATOR:
scene.text: Hopps struggles through the sand.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Scorching sandstorm. You're dead, bunny bumpkin!

scene.title: ON THE VINE-COVERED MONKEY BARS:
scene.text: Hopps swings across the bars, simulating the RAINFOREST DISTRICT. She falls off, landing face first in the mud.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: 1000 foot fall. You're dead, carrot face!

scene.title: TUNDRA TOWN ICE WALL:
scene.text: Judy and the cadets sprint toward the wall. The CLAWED ANIMALS dig into the ice wall. Hopps slides off.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Frigid ice wall. You're dead, farm girl!

scene.title: IN THE BOXING RING:
scene.text: Hopps gets in the ring with a BIG BISON.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: E-normous criminal.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps gets punched in the nose.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: You're dead!

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Dead! / Dead! / Dead!

scene.title: IN THE TOILET:
scene.text: Hopps ruses into a stall. The toilet is considerably larger than she is. She shuts the door. We see her climb up the toilet. In the next stall, we see the feet of a Hippo. Then, KERSPLASH! Hopps falls into the toilet.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Filthy toilet. You're dead, fluff butt!

scene.title: HOPPS ON HER OWN--
scene.text: She runs at sunset-- after everyone else has called it a day. We HEAR the drill instructor's voice echoing in her mind.

scene.title: MAJOR FRIEDKIN
scene.text: Just quit and go home, fuzzy bunny!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Then those of her parents...

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: There's never been a bunny cop.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Never.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Never.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Then Gideon's...

scene.title: GIDEON GREY
scene.text: Just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny.

scene.title: OVERNIGHT, IN THE BARRACKS:
scene.text: Hopps stays up late studying, doing sit ups.

scene.title: ON THE ICE WALL:
scene.text: Hopps bounds up the wall, jumps off of the backs of the big animals and makes it over, impressing the Major Friedkin.
Hopps dodges a few swings. The Bison misses. Hopps bounds over him and uses his momentum-- kicking his other hand into his face, knocking him down.

scene.title: EXT. POLICE ACADEMY - DAY
scene.text: It's graduation day. MAYOR LIONHEART is at the podium.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: As Mayor of Zootopia, I am proud to announce that my Mammal Inclusion Initiative has produced its first police academy graduate.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy stands proudly in her cop uniform.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: Valedictorian of her class, ZPD's very first rabbit officer... Judy Hopps.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy walks to the stage as those in attendance cheer-- her FAMILY chief among them. ASSISTANT MAYOR BELLWETHER applauds. She smiles at Judy, lost in the moment.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: (clearing his throat) Assistant Mayor Bellwether? Her badge.

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: Oh! Yes right.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: Thank you.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Bellwether steps forward to pin Hopps' ZPD badge on her.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: Judy, it is my great privilege to officially assign you to the heart of Zootopia: Precinct One, City Center.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy can barely contain her glee. Her parents are in shock.

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: Congratulations, Officer Hopps.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: I won't let you down. This has been my dream since I was a kid.

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: Ya know, it's a... It's a real proud day for us little guys.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: Bellwether, make room will ya? Come on.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Lionheart shoves Bellwether out of the way.

scene.title: LIONHEART
scene.text: Okay, Officer Hopps. Let's see those teeth!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: A group of PHOTOGRAPHERS aim their cameras. Lionheart steps in front of Bellwether, edging her out of the photo. The flashbulbs pop.

scene.title: EXT. BUNNYBURROW TRAIN STATION - DAY
scene.text: Stu, Bonnie, and several SIBLINGS accompany Judy to the train station.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: We're real proud of you, Judy.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah. Scared, too.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Yes.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Really, it's kind of a proud-scared combo. I mean, Zootopia. It's so far a away... It's such a big city.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: Guys-- I've been working for this my whole life.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: We know. And we're just a little excited for you, but terrified.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: And also bears. We have bears to fear, too. To say nothing of lions, and wolves...

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Wolves?

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: ...weasels...

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: You play cribbage with a weasel.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: And he cheats like there's no tomorrow. You know what, pretty much all predators-- and Zootopia's full of `em.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: (scolding) Oh, Stu.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: And foxes are the worst.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: (retreating) Actually, your father does have a point there. It's in their biology. Remember what happened with Gideon Grey.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: When I was 9. Gideon Grey was a jerk, who happened to be a fox. I know plenty of bunnies who are jerks.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Sure. Yeah, we all do. Absolutely. But just in case, we made you a little care package to take with you.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: And I put some snacks in there.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Stu begins pulling a bunch of PINK FOX DETERRENTS from a bag.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: This is fox deterrent.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah that's safe to have there.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: This is fox repellent...

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Okay, the deterrent and the repellent. That's all she needs.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Check this out!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Stu removes a Fox Taser, fires it up. It sizzles.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Oh for goodness sake. She has no need for a fox taser, Stu.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Oh c'mon. When is there not a need for a fox taser?

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: Okay, look-- I will take this to make you stop talking.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy grabs the pink fox repellent from the bag as the train pulls up.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Terrific! Everyone wins!

scene.title: TRAIN CONDUCTOR
scene.text: Arriving-- Zootopia Express!

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: OK. Gotta go. Bye!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy heads for the train, head held high. No turning back. Stu and Bonnie watch, both holding back tears. Suddenly, the emotion catches up with Judy. She turns, runs back to her parents, hugs them tight.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: I love you guys.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Love you, too!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: One more squeeze, then Judy runs off and jumps on the train.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Oh cripes, here come the waterworks.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Oh Stu, pull it together.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: Bye everybody!

scene.title: COTTON
scene.text: Bye, Judy! I love you!

scene.title: CROWD OF BUNNIES
scene.text: Bye!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As the train pulls away, her family runs next to it, waving.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: Bye!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy looks back as their faces recede into the distance. The train blasts past Bunnyburrow, passing its exponentially increasing population sign. Judy pulls out her iPhone and clicks play... her new life is about to begin and we

scene.title: A MONTAGE --
scene.text: As Hopps takes the train, it rounds a curve. She looks up. Her eyes light up. There in the distance is...

scene.title: EXT. ZOOTOPIA CITY - ESTABLISHING
scene.text: ...THE UNBELIEVABLE ANIMAL METROPOLIS of ZOOTOPIA, which is comprised of amazing habitat "boroughs." The train whips past

scene.title: TUNDRATOWN, SAVANNA CENTRAL, RAINFOREST DISTRICT,
scene.text: MEADOWLANDS, SAHARA SQUARE, etc.

scene.title: INT. ZOOTOPIA CENTRAL STATION - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps spills out of the train... and we are now in a MULTI- SCALE ENVIRONMENT: everything from mice to elephants.

scene.title: EXT. DOWNTOWN ZOOTOPIA - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps emerges into the main Zootopia central plaza. It's an amazing, magnificent place. A JUMBOTRON featuring a gazelle pop star, GAZELLE, blares its message in a loop.

scene.title: GAZELLE
scene.text: I am Gazelle. Welcome to Zootopia!

scene.title: INT. HOPPS'S APARTMENT BUILDING, HALLWAY - DAY
scene.text: DHARMA ARMADILLO, Hopps's older ARMADILLO LANDLADY, opens the door to Hopps' new apartment-- which we can't see yet.

scene.title: DHARMA ARMADILLO
scene.text: And welcome to the Grand Pangolin Arms. "Luxury Apartments with Charm."

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps discovers the room is a tiny, crappy studio apartment.

scene.title: DHARMA ARMADILLO
scene.text: Complimentary de-lousing once a month. (handing over the keys) Don't lose your key.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Thank you!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As Dharma leaves, Hopps' volatile, artsy NEIGHBORS, KUDU and ORYX POOTOSSER, pass by in the hall.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh hi, I'm Judy! Your new neighbor!

scene.title: KUDU POOTOSSER
scene.text: Yeah? Well we're loud.

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: Don't expect us to apologize for it.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Before Hopps can respond, they're gone, leaving Hopps alone. She looks around... blank-faced so it's tough to read her emotions.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Greasy walls... rickety bed...

scene.title: KUDU POOTOSSER
scene.text: Shut up!

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: You shut up!

scene.title: KUDU POOTOSSER
scene.text: No! You shut up!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Crazy neighbors... (big smile as she flops on the bed) I love it!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As the shouting continues, she stretches out on her bed, exhausted but overjoyed.

scene.title: WAKE UP MONTAGE - MORNING
scene.text: Quick, rhythmic cuts of: - Alarm clock: Beep. Beep. Beep. - Dressing: Vest. Badge. Belt. On the bedside table sits the PINK FOX REPELLENT. Judy glances at it and smirks-- taking it would be silly-- she walks out of frame. HOLD on the table. One second. Then Judy's hand comes back into frame and grabs the Repellent.

scene.title: INT. ZOOTOPIA POLICE DEPARTMENT - MORNING
scene.text: Utter mayhem. COPS parade PERPS through the lobby-- one is wearing cuffs and a plastic (not scary) safety muzzle, he complains to the BEAR COP marching him by.

scene.title: LEOPARD
scene.text: C'mon! He bared his teeth first.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: We land at the front desk and find CLAWHAUSER, a PUDGY CHEETAH COP, happily eating a bowl of Lucky Chomps cereal.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Scuse me! Down here? Hi.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Clawhauser leans over the desk to find Hopps.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: O-M goodness! They really did hire a bunny. What?!

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: I gotta tell ya, you are even cuter than I thought you'd be.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (a little wince) Ooo, uh, you probably didn't know, but a bunny can call another bunny "cute," but when other animals do it, it's a little...

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: (gasps, realizing) I am so sorry. Me, Benjamin Clawhauser, the guy everyone thinks is just a flabby, donut-loving cop, stereotyping you...?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: It's okay-- oh, you've actually you've actually got a-- there's a-- in your neck-- the fold-- the-- there's--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Clawhauser removes a small donut from under some neck fat.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Oh, there you went, you little dickens!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He crams the donut into his mouth.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (awkwardly laughing) I should get to roll call, so... which way do I?

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Oh! Bullpen's over there to the left.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Great, thank you!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Clawhauser watches admiringly as she heads to the bullpen.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: (to himself, wistful) Aw... That poor little bunny's gonna get eaten alive.

scene.title: INT. ZPD - BULLPEN - CONTINUOUS
scene.text: Hopps enters the bullpen, by far the smallest animal in the room: rhinos, buffalo, hippos, elephants, etc. Hopps holds her paw out to a tough RHINO, MCHORN.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hey. Officer Hopps. You ready to make the world a better place?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: McHorn gives Hopps a reluctant fist bump, nearly knocking her off the chair.

scene.title: OFFICER HIGGINS
scene.text: TEN HUT!

scene.title: TEN HUT!
scene.text: In walks CHIEF BOGO, a gruff CAPE BUFFALO. He takes the dais. Everyone snaps to attention and starts stomping the floor.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: All right, all right. Everybody sit.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As Hopps sits, she disappears below the DESK that is meant for a rhino.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: I've got three items on the docket. First... we need to acknowledge the elephant in the room. (nods to ELEPHANT) Francine, happy birthday.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: An elephant, FRANCINE, blushes as other cops clap.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Number two: There are some new recruits with us I should introduce. But I'm not going to, because I don't care. Finally...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He turns to a push pin-pocked MAP that's covered in photos of MISSING MAMMALS. Hopps's eyes go wide.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: ...We have 14 missing mammal cases. All predators, from a giant polar bear, to a teensy little otter. And City Hall is right up my tail to find them. This is priority number one. Assignments!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: HIGGINS hands Bogo a stack of CASE FILES. Bogo puts on his reading glasses, examining the files as he assigns cases.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato-- your teams take Missing Mammals from the Rainforest District. Officers McHorn, Rhinowitz, Wolfard, your teams take Sahara Square. Officers Higgins, Snarlov, Trunkaby: Tundratown. And finally, our first bunny, Officer Hopps.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps sits up, expectant but steely. Bogo looks at the final case file in his hand. He takes a dramatic breath, then:

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Parking Duty. Dismissed!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Parking duty? (runs after Bogo) Uh, Chief? Chief Bogo?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Bogo looks around... then down to find Hopps.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Sir, you said there were 14 missing mammal cases?

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: So.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: So I can handle one. You probably forgot, but I was top of my class at the academy.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Didn't forget. Just don't care.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Sir, I'm not just some "token" bunny.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Well, then writing a hundred tickets a day should be easy.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He goes, slamming the door behind him. Judy stomps her foot.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: 100 tickets...? I'm not gonna write 100 tickets... I'm gonna write 200 tickets!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (then, to the closed door) Before noon!

scene.title: INT. / EXT. METER MAID CART - DAY
scene.text: Hopps dons a vest, buckles her seat belt, floors the pedal and... takes off at 2 miles an hour. Which leads to a

scene.title: PARKING METER MONTAGE --
scene.text: Hopps zooms past a row of cars, marking their tires. Cruising the streets, her super-sensitive ears hear a meter ding. She slams her brakes-- then proudly issues Ticket #1. Ding! Another meter goes off. Then another. And another. She's on a roll. She looks down at her counter. It's at 200.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Boom! 200 tickets before noon.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: A final ding... Reveal: her own traffic cart is at an expired meter. Hopps rolls her eyes and writes herself a ticket.
As Hopps puts the ticket on her windshield, she hears a voice across the street:

scene.title: TRUCK DRIVER
scene.text: Hey, watch where you're going, Fox!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps looks across the street to see... a RED FOX. Hopps looks at him, a little suspicious. The Fox looks around, then slinks into a cafأ©. Hopps runs across the street and peeks in the window. It's an ice cream parlor, but... the FOX IS GONE.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (sotto) Where'd he go...

scene.title: INT. JUMBEAUX'S CAFE - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Elephants scoop ice cream with their trunks, suck up nuts with their trunks. It's cute but also disgusting. As Hopps enters, she spots the fox, NICK WILDE, at the front of the line and overhears the proprietor, JERRY, addressing him.

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: Listen, I don't know what you're doing skulking around during daylight hours, but I don't want any trouble in here... So hit the road.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps unsnaps the holster of her PINK FOX REPELLENT.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: I'm not looking for any trouble either, sir. I simply want to buy a Jumbo Pop for my little boy.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Ready for action, slowly creeping forward, Hopps's expression changes when she sees that Nick is with his TODDLER SON.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (to the boy) You want the red or the blue, pal?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Staring at the cute little boy, Hopps is embarrassed by her impulse. She snaps the Repellent holster and begins to leave.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (disgusted with herself) I'm such a...

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: Oh come on, kid. Back up. Listen, buddy, what? There aren't any fox ice cream joints in your part of town?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps suddenly stops. Her ears go up and she turns around.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Uh, no no, there are. There are. It's just, my boy-- (tousles boy's hair) --this goofy little stinker-- he loves all things elephant. Wants to be one when he grows up.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The boy gives a TOOT-TOOT with his toy elephant trunk.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Isn't it adorable? Who the heck am I to crush his little dreams, huh? Right?

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: Look, you probably can't read, fox but the sign says...

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: (slowly reads SIGN, belittling)

scene.title: WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE
scene.text: SERVICE TO ANYONE. So beat it.

scene.title: ELEPHANT
scene.text: You're holding up the line.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The little fox is about to cry, when Hopps walks up.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hello? Excuse me?

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: Hey, you're gonna have to wait your turn like everyone else, metermaid.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Actually... (revealing badge) I'm an officer. Just had a quick question. Are your customers aware they're getting snot and mucous with their cookies and cream?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: An ELEPHANT COUPLE overhear and spit out their ice cream.

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: What are you talkin' about?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Well, I don't wanna cause you any trouble, but I believe scooping ice cream with an un-gloved trunk is a Class 3 Health Code Violation...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: A guilty EMPLOYEE releases a scoop from their trunk.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: ...Which is kind of a big deal. Of course-- I could let you off with a warning if you were to glove those trunks and, I don't know, finish selling this nice dad and his son a... what was it?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: A Jumbo Pop. Please.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: A Jumbo Pop.

scene.title: JERRY JUMBEAUX, JR.
scene.text: (stews for a beat, then) Fifteen dollars.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Thank you so much. (to Hopps) Thank you. (then, digs for wallet) Oh no, are you kidding me? I don't have my wallet. I'd lose my head if it weren't attached to my neck, that's the truth. Oh boy, I'm sorry pal. Gotta be about the worst birthday ever. Please don't be mad at me. (kisses him, to Hopps) Thanks, anyway.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He turns to go. Hopps slaps some money on the counter.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Keep the change.

scene.title: EXT. JUMBEAUX'S CAFE - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Hopps has the Toddler's hand. Nick holds a HUGE JUMBO-POP.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Officer, I can't thank you enough. So kind, really, can I pay you back?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh no, my treat-- it just-- y'know, it burns me up to see folks with such backward attitudes toward foxes. I just wanna say, you're a great dad and just a... a real articulate fella.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Ah, well, that is high praise. It's rare that I find someone so non- patronizing... Officer...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (totally misses his dig) Hopps. Mr...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Wilde. Nick Wilde.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (to Toddler) And you little guy, you want to be an elephant when you grow up... you be an elephant-- because this is Zootopia, anyone can be anything.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps puts a STICKER BADGE on the boy's chest.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Ah, boy, I tell him that all the time. All right here ya go-- (hands him popsicle) Two paws. Yeah. Oh, look at that smile, that's a happy birthday smile! All right, give her a little bye-bye toot toot.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The kid toots.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Toot, toot!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Bye now!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Goodbye!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps walks off with a spring in her step.

scene.title: EXT. SAHARA SQUARE - DAY
scene.text: Hopps continues to write tickets. As she leaves a ticket on another car, she can see a few blocks away. It's NICK and his KID. Hopps gives them a wave, but they don't notice her.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh! Hey, little toot toot--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps realizes they are melting their jumbo-pop in the hot sun, channeling the juice into jugs. Huh? Nick and his kid pack the jugs into a van and NICK'S SON gets in the driver's seat. They drive off, passing Hopps, who stares, confused.

scene.title: EXT. TUNDRATOWN - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps follows them to... Tundratown, where Nick's "son" uses his little paw prints to create molds they pour the popsicle juice into, creating dozens of smaller popsicles. Hopps looks on, scandalized.

scene.title: EXT. SAVANNAH CENTRAL - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps watches them resell the "Pawpsicles" at marked-up prices to LEMMINGS... when one buys one, they all do.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Pawpsicles! Get your pawpsicles!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick rakes in the cash. As the lemmings leave, they throw their used popsicle sticks into a RECYCLING BIN. A second later, Nick's "son," FINNICK, emerges from the bin with a bundle of used popsicle sticks. Hopps is mortified.

scene.title: EXT. LITTLE RODENTIA - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps watches Nick plop down a big bundle of USED POPSICLE STICKS in front of a MOUSE CONSTRUCTION WORKER.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Lumber delivery!

scene.title: MOUSE CONSTRUCTION WORKER
scene.text: What's with the color?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: The color? Uh... It's redwood.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps has now graduated to genuine anger.

scene.title: EXT. OUTSIDE LITTLE RODENTIA - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Nick hands Finnick a wad of cash.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: 39...40. There you go. Way to work that diaper, big guy. Hey, no kiss bye-bye for daddy?

scene.title: FINNICK
scene.text: (super-deep voice) You kiss me tomorrow, I'll bite your face off. Ciao.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As Finnick drives off in his van, BLARING LOUD FRENCH RAP MUSIC. We discover HOPPS behind it, and she is not happy.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Well. I stood up for you, and you lied to me. You liar!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: It's called a hustle, sweetheart. And I'm not the liar, he is.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick points behind Hopps. She turns... no one. She turns back. Nick is gone-- his tail disappears around a corner.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hey!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick walks on, calmly. Hopps hurries up to him.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Alright, slick Nick, you're under arrest.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Really, for what?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Gee I don't know, how `bout selling food without a permit, transporting undeclared commerce across borough lines, false advertising...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick smiles and produces those documents.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Permit. Receipt of declared commerce. And I didn't falsely advertise anything. Take care.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You told that mouse the popsicle sticks were redwood!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: That's right. "Red wood." With a space in the middle. Wood that is red. (then) You can't touch me, Carrots, I been doing this since I was born.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You're gonna wanna refrain from calling me Carrots...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: My bad. I just naturally assumed you came from some little carrot- choked podunk, no?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (isn't it obvious?) Ah, no. Podunk is in Deerbrooke County, and I grew up in Bunnyburrow.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Okay. Tell me if this story sounds familiar: (harsher now, rapidly) Naأ¯ve little hick with good grades and big ideas decides, "Hey lookit me, I'm gonna move to Zootopia-- where Predators and Prey live in harmony and sing Kumbaya!" Only to find-- whoopsie, we don't all get along. And that dream of becoming a big city cop? Double whoopsie! She's a meter maid. And whoopsie number threesie-- NO ONE cares about her or her dreams. And soon enough those dreams die and our bunny sinks into emotional and literal squalor living in a box under a bridge. Til finally she has no choice but to go back home with that cute, fuzzy wuzzy little tail between her legs to become-- you're from Bunnyburrow, is that what you said?-- so how `bout a carrot farmer... That sound about right?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: She's speechless-- How did he get my number so quickly? A RHINO almost crushes her.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Be careful now, it won't just be your dreams getting crushed.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (ever-so-slightly rattled) Hey! Hey! No one tells me what I can or can't be! Especially not some jerk who never had the guts to try to be anything more than a popsicle hustler!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Alright look, everyone comes to Zootopia thinking they can be anything they want. Well you can't. You can only be what you are. (points to himself) Sly fox.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (points to her) Dumb bunny.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I am NOT a dumb bunny.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Right. And that's not wet cement.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: She looks down. She's landed in wet cement.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (as he goes) You'll never be a real cop. You're a cute meter maid though. Maybe a supervisor one day. Hang in there...

scene.title: INT. HOPPS'S APARTMENT, HALLWAY - EVENING
scene.text: CLOSE ON HER WELCOME MAT: Hopps wipes off her cement covered feet. Then she enters

scene.title: THE APARTMENT --
scene.text: Hopps turns on the radio. Everybody Hurts plays. She changes the station. A sadder song comes on. She changes the station repeatedly, each song progressively sadder. Finally, she lands on a treacly instrumental that will score the scene. She puts in a microwave dinner: CARROTS FOR ONE. Hopps takes her food (A SINGLE CARROT) and sits at a small table. Her phone rings. INSERT: MOM & DAD FACETIME. Hopps shakes her head, sighs, then puts on a fake smile and answers.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh hey, it's my parents!

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Aw there she is! Hi sweetheart!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: THE FACETIME cuts between Bonnie on her phone. Stu will pop in and out of frame.

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Hey there, Jude the Dude! How was your first day on the force?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: It was real great.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah? Everything you ever hoped?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Mmm. Absolutely. And more. Everyone's so nice. And I feel like I'm really making a difference--

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: (pops head into frame) Hey, wait a second. Holy cripes, Bonnie! Look at that!

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: (a discovery) Oh my sweet heaven-- Judy, are you a meter maid?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps is still wearing her vest, and her hat is on the chair.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (panicked) Oh this? No! Oh, no no! This is just a temporary thing--

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: It's the safest job on the force!

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Ah, she's not a real cop! Our prayers have been answered!

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Glorious day!

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Meter maid, meter maid!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Dad! Dad--

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Meter maid, meter maid!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: DAD! You know what-- it's been a really long day, I should really--

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: That's right. You get some rest!

scene.title: STU HOPPS
scene.text: Those meters aren't gonna maid themselves.

scene.title: BONNIE HOPPS
scene.text: Bye bye!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (eye roll) Buh-bye.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: She hangs up, defeated. The SELF-PITYING MUSIC comes up full.

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: Hey Bunny! Turn down that depressing music!

scene.title: KUDU POOTOSSER
scene.text: Leave the meter maid alone! Didn't you hear her conversation? She feels like a failure!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Judy turns off the music.

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: Oh, shut up!

scene.title: KUDU POOTOSSER
scene.text: You shut up!

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: You shut up!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (quietly to herself) Tomorrow's another day...

scene.title: ORYX POOTOSSER
scene.text: Yeah, but it might be worse!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Off Judy's exhausted look, we:

scene.title: EXT. STREETS OF ZOOTOPIA - THE NEXT DAY
scene.text: Hopps, on meter maid duty, thunks a ticket on a windshield.

scene.title: MOOSE
scene.text: I was 30 seconds over!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Another meter dings, Hopps puts another ticket on a very small windshield.

scene.title: ANGRY GERBIL LADY
scene.text: Ugh! Yeah you're a real hero, lady!
DING! Another ticket down. A MOTHER HIPPO picks up the ticket, her SMALL CHILD looks right at Hopps.

scene.title: HIPPO CHILD
scene.text: My mommy says she wishes you were dead.

scene.title: ANGRY DRIVER
scene.text: Un-cool, rabbit. My tax dollars pay your salary.

scene.title: INT. METER MAID CART
scene.text: After what has clearly been a series of these encounters, Hopps repeatedly bangs her head on the steering wheel.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (less convinced with each utterance) I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop...

scene.title: FRANTIC PIG
scene.text: Hey!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Suddenly, a PIG bangs on the cart's window. Hopps startles.

scene.title: FRANTIC PIG
scene.text: You! Bunny!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (rote) Sir, if you have a grievance, you may contest your citation in traffic court.

scene.title: FRANTIC PIG
scene.text: What're you talking about? My shop! It was just robbed! Look, he's getting away! Well are you a cop or not?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps sees a WEASEL running with a bag of stolen goods.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (snapping out of it) Oh, yes! Yes! Don't worry, sir, I got this!

scene.title: EXT. STREETS OF ZOOTOPIA - CONTINUOUS
scene.text: Hopps jumps out and gives chase-- ditching her silly vest.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Stop! Stop in the name of the law!

scene.title: DUKE WEASELTON
scene.text: Catch me if you can, Cottontail!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The chase is on. McHorn screeches up in his cop car.

scene.title: DUKE WEASELTON
scene.text: Whoa. Coming through!

scene.title: MCHORN
scene.text: This is Officer McHorn, we got a 10-
Hopps slides across his hood.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I got dibs! Officer Hopps, I am in pursuit!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps chases the Weasel, who races through Savannah Central. As Hopps advances, the Weasel ducks into... LITTLE RODENTIA. Thanks to her small size, Hopps follows him in.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You! Freeze!

scene.title: MCHORN
scene.text: (arriving, but too big to enter) Hey! Metermaid! Wait for the real cops!

scene.title: EXT. LITTLE RODENTIA - CONTINUOUS
scene.text: Hopps emerges in Little Rodentia, teeming with tiny rodents.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Stop!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps spots the Weasel, who's using two mouse cars as skates. She chases after him, smashing through Little Rodentia. As the Weasel jumps off the top of a mouse building, he knocks it over, but Hopps is able to save them from crashing. Resuming the chase, Hopps jumps off the building-- landing precariously in the midst of a large group of mice.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh! Oh, sorry! Coming through! `Scuse me! `Scuse me. Pardon...
Hopps locates Weaselton, who's safely making his escape on the top of a tiny mouse train.

scene.title: DUKE WEASELTON
scene.text: Bon voyage, flat foot!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: But Hopps won't quit. She takes a short cut and knocks him off the train. Rodents scream and run amidst the chaos.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hey! Stop right there!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Weasel throws an ornamental donut at Hopps.

scene.title: DUKE WEASELTON
scene.text: Have a donut, coppah!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: But the donut misses and rolls towards some SHREWS coming out of "Mousies."

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Ohmygawd, did you see those leopard print jeggings? (sees the donut about to kill her) Aaaaaaaaaaaagh!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: But at the last second... Hopps stops it! Deep breath...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I love your hair.

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Aw... thank you.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Meanwhile, the Weasel spots the bag he was stealing and smugly picks it up, ready to leave.

scene.title: DUKE WEASELTON
scene.text: Come to papa...

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Then out of nowhere, Hopps dumps the donut on his head.

scene.title: INT. ZPD - LOBBY - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: The lobby is overflowing with ANIMALS filing MISSING MAMMAL REPORTS. Clawhauser is dealing with an otter, MRS. OTTERTON.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Okay, you're gonna have to be patient and wait in line just like everyone else, Mrs. Otterton, okay?
Just then: BAM! The Weasel (in donut) rolls through the front door and hits Clawhauser's desk. It settles, revealing Hopps.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I popped the weasel!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Behind her, Chief Bogo yells from the second floor.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: HOPPS!

scene.title: INT. ZPD - BOGO'S OFFICE - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Hopps sits in a big chair in front of Bogo, like a kid in the principal's office. Bogo looks over a report.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Abandoning your post, inciting a scurry, reckless endangerment of rodents... but to be fair, you did stop a master criminal from stealing two dozen... moldy onions.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hate to disagree with you, sir, but those aren't onions. Those are a crocus varietal called Midnicampum Holicithias. They're a Class C Botanical, sir. I grew up in a family where plant husbandry was kind of a thing.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Shut your tiny mouth, now.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Sir, I got the bad guy. That's my job.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Your job is putting tickets on parked cars.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Chief, uh, Mrs. Otterton's here to see you again.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Not now.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Okay, I just didn't know if you wanted to take it this time, she seems really upset--

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Not now!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Sir, I don't want to be a meter maid... I wanna be a real cop.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Do you think the Mayor asked what I wanted when he assigned you to me?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: But sir, if you--

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Life isn't some cartoon musical where you sing a little song and your insipid dreams magically come true. So let it go!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: MRS. OTTERTON barges in, with Clawhauser trailing, wheezing.

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: Chief Bogo please-- five minutes of your time. Please...

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: I'm sorry, sir, I tried to stop her, she is super slippery. I gotta go sit down.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Ma'am, as I've told you, we are doing everything we can...

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: My husband has been missing for ten days. His name is Emmitt Otterton.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Yes, I know.

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: He's a florist. We have two beautiful children. He would never just disappear.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mrs. Otterton reveals her own sweet little photo of Emmitt with her and the family.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Ma'am, our detectives are very busy.

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: Please. There's got to be somebody to find my Em.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Mrs. Otterton--

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I will find him.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mrs. Otterton races over to Hopps and gives her a big hug of relief. Bogo looks to Hopps, ready to explode.

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: Oh, thank you! Bless you, bless you little bunny! (hands picture of family) Take this. Find my Emmitt. Bring him home to me and my babies. Please?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Bogo grunts and ushers Mrs. Otterton back outside.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Mrs. Otterton? Please wait out here.

scene.title: MRS. OTTERTON
scene.text: Of course. Oh, thank you both so much.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: One second.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: He closes the door and turns to Hopps, furious.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: You're fired.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What? Why?!

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Insubordination. Now, I'm going to open this door and you're going to tell that otter you're a former meter maid with delusions of grandeur who will not be taking the case.
Bogo opens the door, to find... Bellwether, hugging Mrs. Otterton.

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: I just heard Officer Hopps is taking the case!

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Assistant Mayor Bellwether...

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: (texting) The Mammal Inclusion Initiative is really starting to pay off! Mayor Lionheart is just gonna be so jazzed!

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: No! No, let's not tell the mayor just yet--

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: And I sent it, and it is done, so I did do that. All right, well I'd say the case is in good hands! Us little guys really need to stick together! Right?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Like glue!

scene.title: BELLWETHER
scene.text: (amused laughter) Good one! Just call me if you ever need anything, okay? You've always got a friend at City Hall, Judy. Alright, bye bye!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Thank you, ma'am.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Bogo forces a smile and closes the door, even more pissed.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: I will give you 48 hours.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: YES!

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: That's two days to find Emmitt Otterton.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Okay.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: But, you strike out-- you resign.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps is taken aback by that for a moment... then nods.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh, uh... okay... deal.

scene.title: BOGO
scene.text: Splendid. Clawhauser will give you the complete case file.

scene.title: INT. ZPD - DESK AREA - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: Clawhauser places the Otterton file on his desk for Hopps.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Here ya go! One missing otter!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps opens the file. It's a single piece of paper. What?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: That's it?!

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Yikes! That is the smallest case file I've ever seen! Leads: none, witnesses: none-- and you're not in the computer system yet, so resources: none. (chuckles) I hope you didn't stake your career on cracking this one.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Clawhauser takes a bite of his donut and the crumbs land on a picture in the file, drawing Hopps's attention to it.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Okay. (deep breath) "Last known sighting..."

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps brushes away the crumbs, revealing a picture of Mr. Otterton on the street. Clawhauser annoyingly slurps from a soda bottle. Hopps squints at the picture, intrigued.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Can I just borrow-- (grabbing soda bottle) Thank you.
Hopps uses Clawhauser's bottle to enlarge the picture. She sees Mr. Otterton holding a PAWPSICLE.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Pawpsicle.

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: The murder weapon!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Get your pawpsicle...

scene.title: CLAWHAUSER
scene.text: Yeah, `cause that... What does that mean?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: It means I... have a lead.

scene.title: EXT. DOWNTOWN STREET - LATER
scene.text: We find Nick pushing a BABY STROLLER. HOPPS zooms up in her traffic cart, smiling.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hi! Hello? It's me again!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Hey, it's Officer Toot Toot.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (fake laugh, humoring him) Ha-ha-ho, no actually it's Officer Hopps, and I'm here to ask you some questions about a case.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: What happened, meter maid? Did someone steal a traffic cone? It wasn't me.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps looks ahead, Nick has gone around the corner. Hopps pulls in front of Nick and sounds her siren.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Hey, Carrots, you're gonna wake the baby, I gotta get to work.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: This is important, sir. I think your ten dollars worth of popsicles can wait.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: I make 200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12, and time is money, hop along.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Please, just look at the picture.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps holds up the traffic cam picture of the Otter.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You sold Mr. Otterton that popsicle right? Do you know him?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: I know everybody. And I also know that somewhere there's a toy store missing its stuffed animal, so why don't you get back to your box.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps' ears droop.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Fine. Then we'll have to do this the hard way.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: She puts a boot on the stroller.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Did you just boot my stroller?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Nicholas Wilde, you are under arrest.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: For what? Howting your feewings?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Felony tax evasion.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick smile drops a bit.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah. 200 dollars a day... 365 days a year... since you were 12, that's two decades, so times twenty... (calculating)

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: ...which is one million four- hundred sixty thousand-- I think, I mean I am just a dumb bunny, but we are good at multiplying-- anyway, according to your tax forms... (presenting the forms) ...you reported let me see here: zero. Unfortunately, lying on a federal form is a punishable offense. Five years jail time.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well, it's my word against yours.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps clicks a button on her CARROT PEN, which SPEAKS!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: "200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12."

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Actually, it's your word against yours. And if you want this pen, you're going to help me find this poor missing otter or the only place you'll be selling popsicles is the prison cafeteria. (dramatic smirk) It's called a hustle, sweetheart.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick is utterly speechless.

scene.title: FINNICK
scene.text: She hustled you. (rude laugh) She hustled you good! You're a cop now Nick, you're gonna need one of these! Have fun working with the fuzz!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: THWAP! Finnick slaps his JUNIOR OFFICER STICKER on Nick.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Start talking.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: I don't know where he is. I only saw where he went.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Great, let's go.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: It's not exactly a place for a cute little bunny.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Don't call me cute. (forceful) Get in the car.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Okay. You're the boss.

scene.title: INT. THE MYSTIC SPRING OASIS - LATER
scene.text: The Mystic Spring Oasis is new agey, full of incense, etc. A meditating HIPPIE YAK sits with flies buzzing around his head, matching the tone of his ohm. Hopps enters with Nick and they approach the yak (still with his eyes closed).

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: Oooooooooohmmmmmmmm. Oooooooooooohmmmmmm.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hi, hello.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The yak continues his incessant chanting.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Um, hello? Hello? HELLO?!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The yak finally shakes out of his trance and notices Hopps.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hello! My name is--

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: Ooo, you know, I'm gonna hit the pause button right there, `cause we're all good on Bunny Scout Cookies.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Uh, no... I'm Officer Hopps, ZPD. I'm looking for a missing mammal, Emmitt Otterton. Right here-- (shows photo) --who may have frequented this establishment.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Yak looks at Hopps' picture. His eyes go wide, as if he's about to say something really important, and then:

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: AH-CHOO!

scene.title: AH-CHOO!
scene.text: (flies go everywhere) Yeah, Ol' Emmitt! Haven't seen him in a couple weeks. But hey, you should talk to his yoga instructor, I'd be happy to take you back.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh, thank you so much, I'd appreciate that more than you can imagine. It would be such a big-- (scream) You are naked!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Yak comes around the counter and he IS naked.

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: Huh? Oh for sure, we're a naturalist club.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Yeah, in Zootopia anyone can be anything. These guys... they be naked.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick grins, Hopps isn't pleased.

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: Nangi's just on the other side of the pleasure pool.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Yak opens the doors to a POOL AREA, with tons of naked animals sunning themselves, playing in the pool, etc. Hopps' eyes nearly pop out of her head. Nick leans in.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Does this make you uncomfortable? Because, if so, there's no shame in calling it quits.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Yes there is.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Boy, that's the spirit.

scene.title: EXT. NATURALIST CLUB - COURTYARD - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Nick revels in Hopps' discomfort over the nude animals everywhere. Lots of nude animals. Yax leads them, oblivious.

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: Yeah, some mammals say the naturalist life is weird, but you know what I say is weird? Clothes on animals! Here we go.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nangi's engaging in a string of fairly evocative yoga poses.

scene.title: YAX THE HIPPIE YAK
scene.text: As you can see, Nangi's an elephant, so she'll totally remember everything. Hey Nangi, these dudes have some questions about Emmitt the Otter.

scene.title: NANGI
scene.text: Who?

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: Uh, Emmitt Otterton? Been coming to your yoga class for like 6 years?

scene.title: NANGI
scene.text: I have no memory of this beaver.

scene.title: JUDY
scene.text: He's an otter actually.

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: He was here a couple Wednesdays ago. `Member?

scene.title: NANGI
scene.text: Nope.

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: Yeah, he was wearing a green cable- knit sweater vest, and new pair of corduroy slacks. Oh, and a paisley tie. Sweet Windsor knot. Real tight. Remember that Nangi?

scene.title: NANGI
scene.text: No.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nangi doesn't want to be bothered. And she's useless. Yax is a gold mine, though! Hopps writes down everything he says.

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: Yeah, and we both walked him out and he got into this big ol' white car with a silver trim? Needed a tune up. The third cylinder wasn't firing. `Member that, Nangi?

scene.title: NANGI
scene.text: Nope.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You didn't happen to catch the license plate number, did you?

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: Oh, for sure. It was 29THD03.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: 0, 3... Wow, this is a lot of great info, thank you.

scene.title: YAX
scene.text: Told ya Nangi has a mind like a steel trap. I wish I had a memory like an elephant.

scene.title: EXT. SAHARA SQUARE - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Nick and Hopps emerge.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well, I had a ball. You are welcome for the clue. And seeing as how any moron can run a plate, I will take that pen and bid you adieu.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As Nick reaches to take it, Hopps realizes something and leaves him hanging.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: The plate... I can't run a plate... (frustrated grunt) I'm not in the system yet.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Give me the pen please.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps gets an idea...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (still withholding pen) What was it you said? "Any moron can run a plate?" Gosh... if only there were a moron around who were up to the task...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Rabbit, I did what you asked, you can't keep me on the hook forever.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Not forever. Why, I only have 36 hours left to solve this case. So can you run the plate or not?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Actually, I just remembered I have a pal at the DMV...

scene.title: EXT. DMV - LATER
scene.text: They arrive at the DMV, the "Department of Mammal Vehicles."

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Flash is the fastest guy in there, you need something done, he's on it.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I hope so, we are really fighting the clock and every minute counts. (suddenly stops, alarmed) Wait. They're all sloths?!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Unfortunately, every mammal working there is a... SLOTH. INSERT: SLOTH EMPLOYEES taking extraordinary amounts of time to do the simplest of tasks-- stapling, stamping, etc.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You said this was going to be quick!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (faux innocence) What? Are you saying that because he's a sloth, he can't be fast? I thought in Zootopia anyone could be anything.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick smiles. Hopps doesn't. They head to Flash's station.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Flash, Flash, hundred yard dash! Buddy, it's nice to see ya.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Flash doesn't respond. Beat.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Nice to... (beat) (beat) see you... (beat) (beat) too.
Hopps looks like she's going to die.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Hey Flash, I'd love ya to meet my friend-- uh, darlin' I've forgotten your name.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (fake smile, to Nick) Officer Judy Hopps, ZPD. (shows badge) How are ya?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Flash doesn't respond... then...

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: I am... doing... just...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Fine?

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: ...as well... as... I can... be. What...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (to an impatient Hopps) Hang in there.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: ...can I... do...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate--

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: For you...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Well, I was hoping you could--

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: ...today.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps pauses-- cautiously optimistic that he's finished.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate for us. We are in a really big hurry.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Beat.   Beat.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Sure.    What's the... plate...

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: ...Number?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps takes a breath.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: (several beats)

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: THD03.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: T.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: HD03.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: H.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: D.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Mmhmm. 0, 3.
Flash is just about to say three, but...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Hey Flash, wanna hear a joke?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: No!

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Sure.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: What do you call a three humped camel?

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: I don't... know... (beat) What... do... you call... a...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Three humped camel.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Three humped... camel?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Pregnant.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick laughs at his own joke. Flash doesn't react, then finally raises his head with a smile and....

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Ha... ha... ha... ha...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Ha, ha, yes very funny, very funny, can we please just focus on the task--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Flash slowly reaches over to the sloth next to him.

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Hey... Priscilla...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh no!

scene.title: PRISCILLA
scene.text: Yes... Flash?

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: What... do...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: No!

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: You call... a...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: A three humped camel? Pregnant! Okay, great, we got it, please just-

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Three... humped...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Aggggggghhhhhhh--

scene.title: INT. DMV - LATER
scene.text: A slow DOT-MATRIX printer spits out the address for CAR

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: Here...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... thank you!

scene.title: FLASH
scene.text: You... go.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (frantically reads) 29THD03-- it's registered to... Tundratown Limo Service? A limo took Otterton, and the limo's in Tundratown-- it's in Tundratown!

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Way to hustle, bud. I love ya. I owe ya.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hurry, we gotta beat the rush hour and--

scene.title: EXT. DMV - CONTINUOUS
scene.text: They go outside. It's night.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: IT'S NIGHT?!

scene.title: EXT. SNOWY LOT - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Nick and Hopps reach LEGITIMATE ENTERPRISE CAR SERVICE. Hopps tries to open the lock.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Closed. Great.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Mm. And I will betcha you don't have a warrant to get in. Hm? Darn it. It's a bummer.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: There's a big gated parking lot which is chained shut... but they can see a few limos parking inside, covered in snow.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: You wasted the day on purpose.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Madam, I have a fake badge. I would never impede your pretend investigation.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: It's not a pretend investigation! Look, see-- (showing picture of Otterton) See him? This otter is missing.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well then they should have gotten a real cop to find him.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What is your problem? Does seeing me fail somehow make you feel better about your own sad, miserable life?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick considers this for a moment.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: It does. One hundred percent. (then) Now... since you're sans warrant, I guess we're done?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps considers this and sighs, defeated.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Fine. We are done. Here's your pen.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps then casually throws it over the fence behind her.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Hey! (staring at the pen)

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: First off, you throw like a bunny, second, you're a very sore loser. (starts to climb) See ya later, Officer Fluff, so sad this is over, I wish I could've helped more.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick jumps down onto the other side, but just as he reaches for the pen, Hopps is suddenly right there and snatches it.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: The thing is, you don't need a warrant if you have probable cause, and I'm pretty sure I saw a shifty low-life climbing the fence, so you're helping plenty. Come on.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps cheerfully heads off. Nick watches her, not quite smiling, but he's starting to respect his opponent.

scene.title: EXT. PARKING LOT - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Hopps wipes snow off a back bumper: LICENSE PLATE 29THD03.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: 29THD03... this is it.

scene.title: INT. REFRIGOUSINE - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: They open the big door, which looks like it belongs on a refrigerator. As they snoop around, Hopps uses tweezers to pick up a clump of fur.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Polar bear fur.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (opening glove box)

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What? What?!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps looks up, only to see Nick holding some JERRY VOLE CDs.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: The Velvety Pipes of Jerry Vole! But on CD? Who still uses CDs?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: As Hopps rolls her eyes and goes back to collecting clues, Nick lowers the back partition and his eyes go wide.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Carrots...? If your otter was here... he had a very bad day.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps' flashlight reveals CLAW MARKS covering the back seat.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Those are... claw marks. You ever seen anything like this?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: No.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Through the fog on the floor Hopps spots a wallet.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Oh, wait. Look.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: They slink back into the back seat. Hopps opens up the wallet to find a drivers license for Mr. Otterton.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: This is him. Emmitt Otterton. He was definitely here. What do you think happened?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick spots a cocktail glass... it's etched with a "B."

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well, now wait a minute... (then, suspicious) Polar bear fur... Rat Pack music... fancy cup... (suddenly terrified) I know whose car this is. We gotta go!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Why? Whose car is it?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick tries to put everything back the way he found it.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: The most feared crime boss in Tundratown. They call him Mr. Big and he does not like me, so we gotta go!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: I'm not leaving, this is a crime scene.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well, it's gonna be an even bigger crime scene if Mr. Big finds me here, so we're leaving right now!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick ushers Hopps to the door, but opens it to find two big

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (faux excitement) Raymond! And, is that Kevin?! Long time no see. And speaking of no see, how about you forget you saw me? Huh? For old time's sake?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The polar bears grab Nick and Hopps by their throats...

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: That's a no.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: ...and yank them off screen.

scene.title: INT. POLAR BEAR CAR - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: VROOM! A car whizzes by. Inside, Nick and Hopps sit nervously in the back seat, sandwiched between the polar bears-- one of whom casually scrolls through Zoogle Photos on his phone.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What did you do that made Mr. Big so mad at you?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (sotto) I uh, I may have sold him a very expensive wool rug... that was made from the fur of a... skunk's butt.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (pissed at Nick) Oh, sweet cheese and crackers.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Pull out to reveal the car passing through the security gate of a residential compound. A POLAR BEAR GUARD lets them in.

scene.title: INT. MR. BIG'S RESIDENCE - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: Nick and Hopps are shoved into a room that's right out of The Godfather. A POLAR BEAR enters...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: (sotto) Is that Mr. Big?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (sotto) No.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Now an even BIGGER POLAR BEAR enters...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What about him? Is that him?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: (sotto, frustrated) No.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: ...and then another. The BIGGEST POLAR BEAR yet...

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: That's gotta be him.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Stop talking stop talking stop talking--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The huge polar bear growls at Nick, then reveals a tiny chair upon which sits... a TEENY, TINY ARCTIC SHREW... this is MR. BIG. He sounds like Marlon Brando sped up to 78 rpm.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Mr. Big, sir, this is a simple misunder-

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mr. Big holds out a TINY FINGER for NICK to KISS HIS RING. Nick painstakingly does so.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: This is a simple misunderstanding.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mr. Big motions for Nick to shut up.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: You come here unannounced... on the day my daughter is to be married?

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Well actually we were brought here against our will, so... (Mr. Big is not impressed) Point is, I did not know it was your car, and I certainly did not know about your daughter's wedding.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: I trusted you, Nicky... I welcomed you into my home... we broke bread together... Gram-mama made you her cannoli. And how did you repay my generosity? With a rug... made from the butt of a skunk. A skunk butt rug. You disrespected me. You disrespected my gram-mama who I buried in that skunk butt rug. I told you never to show your face here again, but here you are, snooping around with this... (re. Hopps) What are you, a performer? What's with the costume?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Sir, I am a c--

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Mime! She is a mime. This mime, cannot speak. You can't speak if you're a mime.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: No. I am a cop. And I'm on the Emmitt Otterton case, and my evidence puts him in your car, so intimidate me all you want, I'm going to find out what you did to that otter if it's the last thing I do.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mr. Big considers this and makes that little grunt.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: Then I have only one request: say hello to Gram-mama. Ice `em!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The Polar Bears snatch Nick and Hopps.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Whoa-- I didn't see nothing-- I'm not saying nothing--

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: And you never will--

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The polar bears open a hidden door on the floor, revealing an icy pool beneath.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Please! No no no! If you're mad at me about the rug I've got more rugs!

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick and Hopps are about to be dumped in, when--

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Oh, Daddy, it's time for our dance. (sees them trying to kill Nick) What did we say? No icing anyone at my wedding!

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: I have to, baby. Daddy has to. (to Thugs) Ice `em.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick and Hopps scream and--

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Wait. WAIT! She's the bunny that saved my life yesterday. From that giant donut.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: This bunny?

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Yeah. Hi!

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Hi. (warm, whisper) I love your dress.

scene.title: FRU FRU SHREW
scene.text: Aw, thank you.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Mr. Big motions for the Polar Bears to put Hopps down.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: Put `em down. (then, to Hopps) You have done me a great service. I will help you find the otter. I will take your kindness... and pay it forward.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Hopps and Mr. Big kiss on the cheeks. Nick stares at them... What is happening?

scene.title: INT. WEDDING RECEPTION - A LITTLE LATER
scene.text: A lavish celebration full of arctic animals dancing. We find Nick and Hopps at the head table, next to Mr. Big. They all eat TINY pieces of WEDDING CAKE.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: Otterton is my florist. He's like a part of the family. He had something important he wanted to discuss. That's why I sent that car to pick him up. But he never arrived.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Because he was attacked.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: No... he attacked.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Otterton?

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: Otterton. He went crazy. Ripped up the car, scared my driver half to death and disappeared into the night.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: He's a sweet little otter.

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: My child, we may be evolved... but deep down we are still animals.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick and Hopps trade a worried glance. OVER THE FOLLOWING WE

scene.title: MR. BIG
scene.text: You want to find Otterton... talk to the driver of the car. His name's Manchas, lives in the Rainforest District. Only he can tell you more.

scene.title: EXT. "RAINFOREST DISTRICT" - LATER THAT NIGHT
scene.text: Nick and Hopps make their way across a mossy rope bridge high above the forest floor. It leads to a moss-covered apartment.

scene.title: EXT. "THE CANOPY" - MOMENTS LATER
scene.text: At the door of the DRIVER'S APARTMENT, they ring the bell.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Mr. Manchas? Judy Hopps, ZPD. We just want to know what happened to Emmitt Otterton.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Beat. The door creaks open.

scene.title: MANCHAS
scene.text: You should be asking... what happened to me.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The door opens to the chain, revealing... MANCHAS is... a HUGE JAGUAR-- but he's been badly beaten up. He has a black eye, and a scratches. Nick and Hopps are taken aback.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Whoa. A teensy otter... did that?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: What... happened?

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Off Manchas's look, we

scene.title: A FLASHBACK --
scene.text: Manchas is driving when he's attacked from the back seat.

scene.title: MANCHAS
scene.text: He was an animal... down on all fours... he was a savage.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: The car spins out. Emmitt growls at Manchas then runs off.

scene.title: MANCHAS
scene.text: (haunted) There was no warning, he just kept yelling about the "night howlers." Over and over, "the night howlers..."

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Nick and Hopps share a subtle look-- they have no idea what "night howlers" are.

scene.title: NICK
scene.text: Oh. So you know about the night howlers too? Good, good, good. Because the night howlers are exactly what we are here to talk about. (to Judy) Right?

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Yep. So, uh, you just open the door and tell us what you know and we will tell you what we know. Okay?

scene.title: MANCHAS
scene.text: (considering) Okay.

scene.title: NULL
scene.text: Manchas closes the door and starts to unlock a series of deadbolts. Judy gives Nick an impressed look.

scene.title: HOPPS
scene.text: Clever fox.

scene.title: NULL
